'''Malinda Gayle McCready''' (November 30, 1975 – February 17, 2013)<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/9878386/Mindy-McCready.html "Mindy McCready"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161010050148/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/9878386/Mindy-McCready.html |date=October 10, 2016 }}. ''Daily Telegraph''. February 18, 2013.</ref> was an American [[country music]]<!--do not add any other genre without sources--> singer. Active from 1995 until her death in 2013, she recorded a total of five studio albums. Her debut album, 1996's ''[[Ten Thousand Angels]]'', was released on [[BNA Records]] and was certified 2× Platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]], while 1997's ''[[If I Don't Stay the Night]]'' was certified Gold. 1999's ''[[I'm Not So Tough]]'', her final album for BNA, was less successful, and she left the label. A [[Mindy McCready (album)|self-titled fourth album]] followed in 2002 on [[Capitol Records]]. McCready's fifth and final studio album, ''[[I'm Still Here (album)|I'm Still Here]]'', was released in March 2010 on Iconic Records.

McCready's first four studio albums yielded twelve singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country singles charts. This figure includes the {{Abbr|No.|Number}} 1 hit "[[Guys Do It All the Time]]", as well as the Top 10 hits "[[Ten Thousand Angels (song)|Ten Thousand Angels]]" and "[[A Girl's Gotta Do (What a Girl's Gotta Do)]]".

Although she had not charted a single since 2002, McCready received significant media coverage regarding her troubled personal life and [[suicide attempt]]s and her eventual death by suicide.

==Career==
===Music===
Born Malinda Gayle McCready in [[Fort Myers, Florida]], McCready began singing in her local [[Pentecostal]] church at age 3<ref>[http://www.biography.com/people/mindy-mccready-20638603 Mindy McCready Biography] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160514194545/http://www.biography.com/people/mindy-mccready-20638603 |date=May 14, 2016 }}. Biography Channel. Retrieved February 18, 2013.</ref> and graduated from high school at the age of 16 to begin her music career early.<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p174776|pure_url=yes}} |title=Mindy McCready biography |access-date=October 21, 2008|last=Erlewine |first=Stephen Thomas |author-link=Stephen Thomas Erlewine |website=Allmusic}}</ref>

When she was 18, McCready moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], where she was signed by BNA Records.  Her debut album, ''[[Ten Thousand Angels]],'' was released in 1996 and sold two million copies. The album produced four chart singles on the country charts: the title track at No. 6, followed by her first and only Number One hit, "[[Guys Do It All the Time]]". This song, in turn, was succeeded by "Maybe He'll Notice Her Now", a duet with [[Richie McDonald]], then the lead vocalist of [[Lonestar]]. The fourth and final single, "A Girl's Gotta Do (What a Girl's Gotta Do)", peaked at No. 4.<ref name=billboardsing>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/retrieve_chart_history.do?model.vnuArtistId=147672&model.vnuAlbumId=525117 |title=Artist Chart History – Mindy McCready: Singles |publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=November 3, 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081221080625/http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/retrieve_chart_history.do?model.vnuArtistId=147672&model.vnuAlbumId=525117 |archive-date=December 21, 2008 }}</ref>

In 1997, she was nominated for Top New Female Vocalist at the [[Academy of Country Music Awards]], but lost to [[LeAnn Rimes]].

The next year, McCready released the album ''[[If I Don't Stay the Night]].'' The album spawned three singles, "What If I Do", "The Other Side of This Kiss", and "You'll Never Know". The album sold 825,000 copies.<ref name=cnn>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2005/SHOWBIZ/Music/09/30/music.mindymccready.ap/index.html|title=Mindy McCready's troubled road|date=September 30, 2005|publisher=CNN.com|access-date=June 27, 2008|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20080602134413/http://www.cnn.com/2005/SHOWBIZ/Music/09/30/music.mindymccready.ap/index.html |archive-date = June 2, 2008}}</ref>

In 1999, McCready released ''[[I'm Not So Tough]].'' The first single, "All I Want Is Everything", failed to break the top 50. The album was a commercial failure, selling 144,000 copies. Soon after, McCready's record company dropped her. McCready was then signed by [[Capitol Records]]. She released her [[Mindy McCready (album)|self-titled album]] with Capitol in 2002 to disappointing sales and was dropped by Capitol later that year.<ref name=cnn />

In May 2008, McCready released the single "I'm Still Here" via her official website. She also announced that she had been working on a documentary, a new album, and a reality show.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20201034,00.html|title=Mindy McCready Thanks Fans, Releases a New Song|last=Dagostino|first=Mark |date=May 8, 2008|magazine=People|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> McCready's critically acclaimed fifth album, ''I'm Still Here'', was released in March 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mindy-mccready-not-aware-of-sex-tape/|title=Mindy McCready: "Not Aware" of Sex Tape|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20100401133801/https://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/03/30/entertainment/main6347732.shtml|archive-date= April 1, 2010|date=March 30, 2010|publisher=cbsnews.com|url-status=live|access-date=March 31, 2010}}</ref>

On February 18, 2013, the day after McCready's death, her final song, "I'll See You Yesterday" was released.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Drury |first1=Sharareh |last2=Finn |first2=Natalie |title=Mindy McCready's Last Song: Exclusive Details |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/389816/mindy-mccready-s-last-song-i-ll-see-you-yesterday-has-whole-new-meaning-now-says-writer |website=E! Online |date=February 19, 2013}}</ref>

===Reality television===
In June 2009, McCready signed on to appear on the reality series ''[[Celebrity Rehab with Dr. Drew]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebritynews/news/dennis-rodman-mindy-mccready-sign-on-for-celebrity-rehab-200916|title=Dennis Rodman, Mindy McCready Sign On for Celebrity Rehab|date=June 1, 2009|publisher=usmagazine.com|access-date=March 31, 2010}}</ref> The series aired and depicted her struggle with substance addiction.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realityblurred.com/realitytv/archives/celebrity_rehab/2009_May_28_season_three_cast|title=Dennis Rodman, Heidi Fleiss, Mackenzie Phillips, Joey Kovar, Lisa D'Amato cast on Celebrity Rehab 3|publisher=Reality Blurred|author=Andy Dehnart|author-link=Andy Dehnart|date=May 28, 2009|access-date=December 11, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090605171033/http://www.realityblurred.com/realitytv/archives/celebrity_rehab/2009_May_28_season_three_cast|archive-date=June 5, 2009|url-status=dead}}</ref>  She later discussed her recovery and possible studio work with Todd Gaither on a March 2010 episode of ''[[The View (U.S. TV series)|The View]]''.{{episode needed|date=January 2014}}

In mid-2011, McCready appeared on an episode of each of ''[[Celebrity Close Calls]]'' and ''[[Celebrity Ghost Stories]]''. She also appeared on the December 9, 2011 episode of ''[[20/20 (U.S. TV program)|20/20]]'', where she discussed her son Zander, her producer boyfriend David Wilson, and new music.

==Personal life==
In 1997, McCready became engaged to actor [[Dean Cain]];<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,289483,00.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081221101551/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,289483,00.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 21, 2008|title=Monitor: Pop Culture News|last=Karger|first=Dave|date=September 19, 1997|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> the couple ended their engagement and separated the following year.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20196311,00.html|title=Mindy McCready Admits to Relationship with Roger Clemens|last=Finan|first=Eileen |date=April 29, 2008|magazine=People|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> McCready also dated then-[[NHL]] hockey player [[Drake Berehowsky]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0511/11/lkl.01.html | work=CNN | title=Interview With Mindy McCready|date=November 11, 2005}}</ref>

In December 2003, she began dating aspiring singer William Patrick "Billy" McKnight. On May 8, 2005, McKnight was arrested and charged with attempted murder after beating and choking her.<ref name=cnn /><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.foxnews.com/story/mccready-says-she-still-loves-boyfriend|title=McCready Says She Still Loves Boyfriend|date=November 5, 2005|publisher=FOXNews.com|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080503073817/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,174558,00.html|archive-date=May 3, 2008|url-status=live}}</ref> After reporting to ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine that she had cut ties with McKnight, McCready was found unconscious in a hotel lobby in [[Indian Rocks Beach, Florida]], after attempting [[suicide]] in July 2005. She was hospitalized for a drug overdose after consuming a large amount of undisclosed drugs with alcohol.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20144062,00.html|title=Mindy Mccready's Downward Spiral|last=Smolowe|first=Jill |date=August 15, 2005|magazine=People|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> The couple soon got back together and McCready became pregnant. In September 2005, while she was pregnant with McKnight's child, she attempted suicide again by overdosing on [[antidepressant]]s.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1109265,00.html|title=Pregnant Mindy McCready Overdoses|last=Silverman|first=Stephen M.|date=September 24, 2005|magazine=People|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> In March 2006, McCready gave birth to a son, Zander Ryan McCready.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_hb5143/is_200605/ai_n18585806 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081221165125/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_hb5143/is_200605/ai_n18585806 |url-status=dead |archive-date=December 21, 2008 |title=Births |date=May 2006 |magazine=Variety |access-date=June 27, 2008 }}</ref>

On December 17, 2008, paramedics were called to McCready's Nashville home after an apparent suicide attempt; they transported her to a hospital after finding wounds on her wrists.<ref>[http://www.usmagazine.com/news/mindy-mccready-hospitalized-after-apparent-suicide-attempt Singer McCready Hospitalized After Apparent Suicide Attempt] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090829103433/http://www.usmagazine.com/news/mindy-mccready-hospitalized-after-apparent-suicide-attempt |date=August 29, 2009 }} US Weekly, December 17, 2008</ref>

In 2009, she joined the cast of ''[[Celebrity Rehab with Dr. Drew|Celebrity Rehab 3]]'' with Dr. Drew Pinsky.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/dr-drew-no-more-celebrity-rehab-after-cast-member-deaths/|title=Dr. Drew: No more "Celebrity Rehab" after cast member deaths|access-date=November 3, 2016}}</ref>

On May 25, 2010, McCready was hospitalized in [[Cape Coral, Florida]], for a possible drug overdose; she may have had a reaction to [[Darvocet]] her mother had given her.<ref name="WBBH">{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc-2.com/Global/story.asp?S=12539270|title=Country singer McCready hospitalized for overdose|date=May 25, 2010|publisher=WBBH-TV|access-date=May 25, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223185812/http://www.nbc-2.com/Global/story.asp?S=12539270|archive-date=February 23, 2012|url-status=dead}}</ref> She was released later that day and returned home.<ref name="Lush">{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jh5HOQnBbPc_YaMBBIl4pxfvbhqgD9FU6PC80 |title=Country singer McCready out of hospital in Fla |last=Lush |first=Tamara |date=May 26, 2010 |agency=Associated Press |access-date=May 26, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100529212859/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jh5HOQnBbPc_YaMBBIl4pxfvbhqgD9FU6PC80 |archive-date=May 29, 2010 }}</ref>

A pornographic videotape of McCready and an ex-boyfriend referred to as "Peter"<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nationalledger.com/pop-culture-news/mindy-mccready-tape-basebal-473035.shtml|title=Mindy McCready Tape – "Baseball Mistress" Reveals Roger Clemens Tales for Vivid |work=National Ledger |date=March 29, 2010|access-date=March 31, 2010}}</ref> went on sale by [[Vivid Entertainment]] in 2010.<ref>{{cite news|last=McKay|first=Hollie|title=EXCLUSIVE: New Mindy McCready Sex Tape Includes Interview About Roger Clemens|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2010/03/29/exclusive-mindy-mccready-sex-tape-released-talks-affair-roger-clemens/?test=faces|publisher=Fox News|date=March 29, 2010}}</ref>

In April 2012, McCready gave birth to her second child, a son named Zayne.<ref>[http://celebritybabies.people.com/2012/04/12/mindy-mccready-welcomes-son-zayne/ "Mindy McCready Welcomes Son Zayne"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304102432/http://celebritybabies.people.com/2012/04/12/mindy-mccready-welcomes-son-zayne/ |date=March 4, 2016 }}. ''People''. April 12, 2012.</ref> The child's father, record producer David Wilson, was found dead on January 13, 2013, at McCready's home, of an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound. The Cleburne County, Arkansas, sheriff's department opened an investigation into Wilson's death.<ref name=EOnlineWilson>{{cite news|last=Loinaz|first=Alexis L.|title=Mindy McCready Denies She Killed Boyfriend David Wilson, Blasts Reports of an Affair|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/382780/mindy-mccready-denies-she-killed-boyfriend-david-wilson-blasts-reports-of-an-affair|newspaper=E! Online|date=January 29, 2013}}</ref><ref name=HuffPostWilson>{{cite news|title=Mindy McCready's Boyfriend Dead: Country Singer's 'Life Partner' David Wilson Dies In Apparent Suicide|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/01/15/mindy-mccready-boyfriend-dead-apparent-suicide_n_2478427.html|newspaper=The Huffington Post|date=January 15, 2013}}</ref> Following Wilson's death, McCready released a statement in which she referred to him as her "soulmate" and "life partner".<ref name="NYDailyNewsWilson">{{cite news |last=Red |first=Christian |date=January 15, 2013 |title='David was my soulmate': Country singer Mindy McCready's boyfriend David Wilson commits suicide |newspaper=New York Daily News |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/country-singer-mindy-mccready-boyfriend-david-wilson-commits-suicide-article-1.1240171}}</ref>

===Roger Clemens affair===
In April 2008, the ''[[New York Daily News]]'' reported a possible long-term relationship between McCready and baseball star [[Roger Clemens]] that began when she was 15.<ref name=nydaily>{{cite news | last = Thompson | first = Teri |author2=Nanthaniel Vinton |author3=Christian Red | title =Roger Clemens had 10-year fling with country star Mindy McCready |newspaper=Daily News|date =April 28, 2008| url = http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/baseball/yankees/sources-roger-clemens-10-year-fling-country-star-mindy-mccready-article-1.171271| location=New York}}</ref> Clemens's attorney admitted that a relationship existed but described McCready as a "close family friend." He also stated that McCready had traveled on Clemens's plane and that Clemens's wife knew McCready.<ref name=nydaily /> Clemens issued a statement saying, "I have made mistakes in my personal life for which I am sorry."<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.foxnews.com/story/report-mindy-mccready-in-apparent-suicide-attempt | publisher=Fox News | title=Report: Mindy McCready in Apparent Suicide Attempt | date=December 17, 2008 | access-date=December 18, 2008 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081218061230/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,468924,00.html | archive-date=December 18, 2008 | url-status=live | df=mdy-all }}</ref>

In November 2008, McCready spoke in more detail to ''[[Inside Edition]]'' about her affair with Clemens. She stated that their relationship lasted for a decade, ending when Clemens refused to marry her. Additionally, McCready said that she was 16 when they first met and that the relationship didn't become sexual until several years later.<ref name=si.com>{{cite news|title=Report: Mindy McCready talks about Clemens Affair |publisher=sportsillustrated.cnn.com |date=November 17, 2008 |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2008/baseball/mlb/11/17/clemens.mcready.ap/index.html |access-date=November 18, 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081206013048/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2008/baseball/mlb/11/17/clemens.mcready.ap/index.html |archive-date=December 6, 2008 }}</ref>

===Legal issues===
In August 2004, McCready was arrested in [[Tennessee]] for using a fake prescription to buy the painkiller [[Oxycodone|OxyContin]]. Although she initially denied the charge, she pleaded guilty and was fined {{US$|4000|link=yes}} ({{Inflation|US|4000|2004|r=-2|fmt=eq}}), sentenced to three years of [[probation]], and ordered to perform 200 hours of [[community service]].<ref>[http://www.eonline.com/News/Items/0,1,14663,00.html E! Online article on McCready's 2004 arrest, part one.]   {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20041127220021/http://www.eonline.com/News/Items/0%2C1%2C14663%2C00.html |date=November 27, 2004 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.eonline.com/News/Items/0,1,14783,00.html E! Online article on McCready's 2004 arrest, part two.]   {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20041127063242/http://www.eonline.com/News/Items/0%2C1%2C14783%2C00.html |date=November 27, 2004 }}</ref>

In May 2005, McCready was stopped by Nashville police for speeding, then arrested and charged with [[driving under the influence]] and driving with a suspended license.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mindy-mccready-cops-targeted-me/|title=Mindy McCready: Cops Targeted Me|date=July 18, 2006|publisher=CBSNews.com|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> A jury later found her not guilty on the charges of DUI but guilty of driving with a suspended license.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/id/wbna13941794|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121008115127/http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/13941794|url-status=live|archive-date=October 8, 2012|title=Mindy McCready found not guilty in DUI trial|date=July 19, 2006|publisher=[[MSNBC]]|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> That July, she was charged in [[Arizona]] with [[identity theft]], unlawful use of transportation, unlawful imprisonment, and hindering prosecution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b50559_Mindy_McCready_Jailed.html |title=Mindy McCready Jailed |last=Hall |first=Sarah |date=August 29, 2005 |publisher=Eonline.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629042709/http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b50559_Mindy_McCready_Jailed.html |archive-date=June 29, 2011 }}</ref> An arrest [[Warrant (law)|warrant]] was issued for her the following month for violation of her probation when she left Tennessee without her probation officer's permission. She was also charged with not reporting to her probation officer during July.<ref>[https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20050810/ap_en_mu/people_mccready_warrant Yahoo.com August 10, 2005 on McCready's arrest warrant issuance.] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050814081556/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20050810/ap_en_mu/people_mccready_warrant |date=August 14, 2005 }}</ref> She was finally arrested in Florida and returned to Tennessee. She faced a hearing later that year on charges of violating her probation on a drug charge by failing to check in with her probation officer and leaving the state without permission to go to [[Florida]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://de.eonline.com/uberblog/b44186_mindy_mccready_takes_it_back.html|title=Mindy McCready Takes it Back|last=Hall|first=Sarah|date=August 22, 2006|publisher=de.eonline.com|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref>

In July 2007, McCready was arrested in her hometown of [[Fort Myers, Florida]], and charged with battery and resisting arrest for an apparent scuffle with her mother.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/arts/AP-People-McCready.html ''New York Times'' July 22, 2007 on McCready's Florida arrest the previous day.] {{dead link|date=April 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> The following week, she was taken into custody at the [[Nashville International Airport]] for violating probation.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2007-07-25-mindy-mccready_N.htm|title=Singer Mindy McCready taken into custody|date=July 26, 2007|newspaper=USA Today|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> In September, McCready was sentenced to a year in jail for violating probation. In addition to the jail time, she was ordered to serve two more years of probation and perform 200 additional hours of community service. She was released from jail in December.<ref>[https://archive.today/20120914080008/http://www.usatoday.com/life/music/2007-09-14-2585900493_x.htm McCready sentenced to 1 year in prison]. USA Today. September 15, 2007</ref>

In June 2008, McCready was arrested in Tennessee for violating the terms of her probation set in September 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/article/10110/mindy-mccready-arrested-again/katie-holmes?__source=related-headlines|title=Mindy McCready Arrested — Again|date=June 26, 2008|publisher=accesshollywood.com|access-date=June 27, 2008}}</ref> Sentenced to 60 days in jail, McCready turned herself in on September 30, 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20229490,00.html|title=Mindy McCready Going Back to Jail|last=Dyball|first=Rennie |date=September 29, 2008|publisher=people.com|access-date=November 3, 2008}}</ref> After serving half of her sentence, she was released early for good behavior on October 30, 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20237282,00.html |title=Mindy McCready Released From Jail |work=People |first=Howard |last=Breuer |date=October 31, 2008 |access-date=November 2, 2008}}</ref>

McCready was associated with and allegedly victimized by con man Jonathan Roda.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://people.com/archive/mindy-mccreadys-downward-spiral-vol-64-no-7 |title=Mindy McCready's Downward Spiral |work=People |date=August 15, 2005 |access-date=December 7, 2016}}</ref>  The case was featured on the 2012 episode "[[I (Almost) Got Away with It#ep66|Got to Make You a Superstar]]" of the series ''[[I (Almost) Got Away with It]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/01/i-almost-got-away-with-it-country-star-conned-video_n_1726922.html|title=Con Artist Stole Millions Of Dollars, Scammed Country Star |date=August 1, 2012 |publisher=huffingtonpost.com}}</ref>

==Death==
On February 17, 2013, McCready's neighbors called the Sheriff's Office of [[Cleburne County, Arkansas]], reporting gunshots. McCready was found dead on her front porch from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the same place where David Wilson, her former boyfriend and the father of her younger son, had fatally shot himself one month prior.<ref name="NYDailyNews2.17.13">Red, Christian (February 17, 2013). [http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/mindy-mccready-reportedly-commits-suicide-article-1.1266650 "Troubled country music star Mindy McCready, 37, who had affair with ex-Yankee Roger Clemens, kills her dog and then commits suicide"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160508145324/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/mindy-mccready-reportedly-commits-suicide-article-1.1266650|date=May 8, 2016}}. ''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]'' (New York).</ref><ref>Gray, Melissa (February 17, 2013). [http://www.cnn.com/2013/02/17/showbiz/mindy-mccready-death/?hpt=hp_t1 "Embattled country star Mindy McCready dead at 37"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160806114635/http://www.cnn.com/2013/02/17/showbiz/mindy-mccready-death/?hpt=hp_t1 |date=August 6, 2016 }}. [[CNN]].</ref> She was 37 years old.<ref name=BBCNews/><ref>{{cite web|last=Schabner|first=Dean|title=Country Singer Mindy McCready Dead at 37|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/country-singer-mindy-mccready-dead-37/story?id=18527193|publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|access-date=February 18, 2013}}</ref> She also shot and killed Wilson's pet dog before her suicide.<ref name=NYDailyNews2.17.13/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1702232/mindy-mccready-killed-dog-before-taking-her-own-life.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130224003157/http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1702232/mindy-mccready-killed-dog-before-taking-her-own-life.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=February 24, 2013 |title=Mindy McCready Killed Dog Before Taking Her Own Life |publisher=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]] |date=February 19, 2013|access-date=February 20, 2013}}</ref> McCready is interred at Alva Cemetery in [[Alva, Florida]].
